title: Elon Musk Says Twitter Has Had Massive Revenue Drop
description: Elon Musk tweeted that Twitter has had a massive drop in revenue due to activist groups pressuring advertisers, as the social-media company started sweeping layoffs just over a week after the billionaire took it over.

title: When Will Flying Taxis Get Off the Ground?
description: The CEO of Boeing-backed Wisk Aero on what it will take to build the market, and what is the loudest part of the trip

title: Chip Makers Cut Costs as Demand Slump Supplants Pandemic's Chip Shortage
description: After sharp growth from Covid, semiconductor executives are now enacting hiring pauses.

title: The Unraveling of Trevor Milton: 'Trouble for Troublemakers'
description: As investors and General Motors bet on Trevor Milton’s vision, the short sellers at Hindenburg Research revealed that the company he founded, Nikola, wasn’t all that it seemed. The allegation that Nikola rolled its truck down a hill for a promotional video made Hindenburg’s report a sensation. In this episode, we’ll hear how Trevor Milton, investors and the U.S. government responded to the report—and how its authors ended up in a game of Spy vs. Spy with shadowy private investigators.

title: Reported Ransomware Incidents, Costs Soared in 2021, Treasury Says
description: Bank reports show the number and value of ransomware-related transactions more than doubled last year from 2020, though the true numbers are thought to be far higher.

title: Sorry, Elon: The Masses Probably Won't Pay for Social Media---But I Will
description: Elon Musk plans to charge $8 a month for a premium Twitter subscription. Others like Snap, LinkedIn and Instagram all are embracing step-up subscriptions, too. What’s the value?

title: Twitter Tells Employees Layoffs Will Be Announced Friday
description: The move comes about a week after Elon Musk acquired the social-media platform.
